p: Reactive oxygen species (ROS) has been implicated in the mechanism of red blood cells damage [ 55] in the diabetic condition [ 56]. Previous studies reported the ROS generation in chronic high blood glucose levels, through several mechanisms including glucose autoxidation, the oxidation of protein [ 57, 58], or the nonenzymatic glycation of protein [ 59] that exacerbate oxidative stress. It is known that streptozotocin induced hydrogen peroxide (H 2O 2) generation and DNA fragmentation in pancreatic islets [ 60] which could justify the increase in catalase activity observed in the present study.
